lines.text: "Last time on Gun City, the Temple of Tepenguin of Doom, our heroes went for drinks at the
popular Gadsville bar, the Gadfly, where they celebrated, along with friends Rex and Marie,
their victory in the arena, the Octagon, and their assurance to a no-hassle visitation
of the land caves, where they will find the next clue to discovering the Temple of Tepenguin
of doom in order to obtain the infamous N-word pass.
Make sure we got all of it.
Ray William Johnson robbed, unrobbed, and then sort of re-robbed the establishment, while
Patrick Yoda played hot scotch and vomited all over himself.
Lotus Piss absolutely crushed with a tight five that involved calling everyone frogs,
and later Marie gave them a strange amulet from Leo, a blank DVD with a string running
through the center like a necklace. After a night of merriment our gang headed back to the that's
what she said inn where they locked the owner of the establishment inside of a supply closet
and slept in the arcade. Ray William Johnson explored his feminine side and the boys reignited
the once lauded profession of arcade repairman. The next day our heroes headed back to the gateway
Gad Cow, where they were let in with no issue by beautiful Simon, the Gads' attendant, who
led them straight into the Gad throne room in the hollowed out cow.
Despite deep suspicions, Baby Gad kept his word, and goo goo gah gahed his daddy into
allowing the boys to have a one hour pass into the land caves.
Approaching the caves, Ray William Johnson almost killed Sullivan the Frog by throwing
him directly into a pile of deadly hissing wires.
where he immediately lost a lot of blood and passed out.
Thanks to a lucky roll, and because I am a generous DM,
Sullivan does not remember this happening.
Patrick Yoda made quick work of the hissing snakes
with a clever use of his foreskin,
and the boys made it into the cave.
The cave entrance was filled with runes, a DDR pad, NES controller, an old PC...
I don't really want to talk about this part.
I'm still reeling a bit.
I feel like perhaps I've become less of a DM in the eyes of the listener.
I'll do everything in my power to win you back, and I'm sorry.
